titles.title: Irrigation Mitigation and Restoration Partnership Act of 1999
Irrigation Mitigation and Restoration Partnership Act of 1999
Irrigation Mitigation and Restoration Partnership Act of 1999
Irrigation Mitigation and Restoration Partnership Act of 2000
Fisheries Restoration and Irrigation Mitigation Act of 2000

To authorize the Secretary of the Army to develop and implement projects for fish screens, fish passage devices, and other similar measures to mitigate adverse impacts associated with irrigation system water diversions by local governmental entities in the States of Oregon, Washington, Montana, and Idaho.

To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to plan, design, and construct fish screens, fish passage devices, and related features to mitigate adverse impacts associated with irrigation system water diversions by local governmental entities in the States of Oregon, Washington, Montana, Idaho, and California.

A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to establish a program to plan, design , and construct facilities to mitigate impacts associated with irrigation system water diversions by local governmental entities in the Pacific Ocean drainage of the States of Oregon, Washington, Montana, and Idaho.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committee on Resources, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

action.text: Discharged by Full Committee.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported in lieu of S.1723 with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski with an amendment in the nature of a substitute and an amendment to the title. With written report No. 106-239.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 455.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Unanimous Consent.

House agreed to Senate amendments with amendments pursuant to H. Res. 630.

Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Federal aid to water resources development

bill.summary: 4/13/2000--Passed Senate amended. Irrigation Mitigation and Restoration Partnership Act of 2000 - Establishes within the Department of the Interior the Irrigation Mitigation and Restoration Partnership Program. Directs the Secretary of the Interior, under such Program, to develop and implement projects to mitigate impacts to fisheries resulting from the construction and operation of water diversions by local governmental entities in the Pacific Ocean drainage area (areas of Oregon, Washington, Montana, and Idaho from which water drains into the Pacific Ocean).Makes projects that receive funds under this Act ineligible to receive Federal funds from any other source for the same purpose.Authorizes appropriations.
